title: Site
description_array: The http.pl compare verb relies on:
- a JSON configuration file addressed by the '--json' command-line option,
- a chromedriver server to talk to the Selenium::Remote::Driver package; runs it with '~/data/chromedriver-linux64/chromedriver --port=9515',
- a local nginx server which redirects the configured port (defaulting to 9516) to the chromedriver listening port (here, 9515).
NB:
1. The chromedriver version MUST match the currently running Chromium version.

bases.description: The base URLs to be compared.

new.description: The (mandatory) base URL to be compared against the above reference.

command.description: The command to run the chromedriver.

driver_port.description: The port the chromedriver is listening to.

height.description: The height in pixels of the internal browser window.

timeout.description: The timeout in seconds of interactions with internal browser.

width.description: The width in pixels of the internal browser window.

workdir.description: Let the created browsers define their user-data-dir inside of 'owrkdir'. Must be inside of a POSIX filesystem.

description_array: The full description of how to compare the two sites, and how provide the comparison results.
We can compare rendered HTMLs as well as screenshots of the rendered pages.
When comparison is enabled, we can just count (the minimum), and/or keep the objects too, and/or isolate them in a separate directory.

htmls.description: Whether and how to compare rendered HTMLs.

enabled.description: Whether the HTMLs comparison is enabled.

ignore.description: A list of patterns to be ignored when comparing.

dom_attributes.description: The list of regexes of DOM attributes to be ignored.

dom_selectors.description: The list of regexes of DOM selectors to be ignored.

text_patterns.description: The list of regexes of text patterns to be ignored.

screenshots.description: Whether and how to compare screenshots of rendered pages.

enabled.description: Whether the screenshots comparison is enabled.

threshold_count.description: The count of accepted differences, computed with an avg square method.

crawl.description: The full configuration of the iterative/recursive searches.

by_click.description: The description of a crawling operations by clicking anywhere.

css_excludes.description: The list of CSS selectors to exclude. Empty means none. Patterns are applied against the CSS selector of the clickable.

enabled.description: Whether we want crawl by clicking anywhere. Overridable in the command-line.

finders.description: How to find the clickables in this website.

href_deny_paterns.description: The list of href patterns to exclude. Empty means none. Patterns are applied against the 'href' attribute of the clickable.

intermediate_screenshots.description: Whether to save intermediate screenshots when restoring a chain. Mostly useful while debugging the verb.

xpath_deny_paterns.description: The list of xpath patterns to exclude. Empty means none.

description_array: The description of a crawling operations by following the links.
Please note that this 'by link' crawl mode is not the best adapted to the SPA and/or multi-frames sites.

css_excludes.description: The list of CSS selectors to exclude. Empty means none. Patterns are applied against the CSS selector of the current element.

enabled.description: Whether we want crawl by following the links. Overridable in the command-line.

description_array: How to find the links in this website.
The links are extracted from the sanitized HTML, so after having applied the 'compare.ignore' exclusions.

find.description: The CSS selector to find a link.

member.description: The member of the hash from where the link is readable.

honor_query.description: Whether to follow and honor the query fragment of the URI.

href_allow_patterns.description: The list of href member patterns to allow. Empty means all. Patterns are applied against the 'member' of the current finder expression.

href_deny_paterns.description: The list of href member patterns to exclude. Empty means none. Patterns are applied against the 'member' of the current finder expression.

url_allow_patterns.description: The list of URLs patterns to allow. Empty means all. Patterns are applied against the full candidate URL.

url_deny_paterns.description: The list of URLs patterns to exclude. Empty means none. Patterns are applied against the full candidate URL.

make_sitemap_csv.description: Whether to build a sitemap at the end.

max_visited.description: The maximum total count of visited pages. Zero stands for unlimited. Overridable in the command-line.

same_host.description: Whether to stay inside of the same domain.

description_array: The subdirectory parts of output directories.
They are all subdirectories of the per-role log directory.
We have six potential output directories which are 'ref', 'new' and 'diffs' crossed with 'htmls' and 'screenshots', but we only manage five as we do not try to keep html diffs.
This object says how they are organized.
An empty string means that the files must not be kept.

diffs.description: The differences output directories. We only manage screenshots here.

htmls.description: The subdirectories of differences kept html files.
The subdirectories of new kept html files.

screenshots.description: The subdirectories of new kept screenshots.

htmls.description: The subdirectories of reference kept html files.

screenshots.description: The subdirectories of reference kept screenshots.

forms.description: The list and description of forms to be handled.

submit_selector.description: The CSS selector of the submit element.
submit_selector.default: When not specified, the form is expected to react on 'change' event.

password_selector.description: The CSS selector of the password field.

path.description: The path to the login page.

session_cookie_regex.description: A regex which identifies the name of the session cookie.

submit_selector.description: The CSS selector of the submit button.

username_selector.description: The CSS selector of the username field.

description_array: An optional list of roles to be checked.
At least one role is mandatory as soon as the sites require some sort of authentication.
When no role is configured, then the verb assumes that the to-be-compared sites are public, and do not require authentication.
Fondamentaly, a role is just a credentials group with a name.

credentials.description: The credentials to be used when checking this role.

enabled.description: Whether this role must be considered.

routes.description: the list of paths to be tested.
